game_objective.title: Game Objective
game_objective.description: Tic Tac Toe is a classic strategy game where two players take turns placing their symbols on a grid. The first player to get three (or more on larger boards) of their symbols in a row, either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally, wins!

how_to_play.title: How to Play
how_to_play.player1_starts: Player 1 ({symbol}) always starts the game by placing their symbol first. Player 2 ({symbol2}) follows.
how_to_play.click_to_place: Simply click on any empty cell on the game board to place your symbol.
how_to_play.get_in_row: Get your symbols in a row (horizontal, vertical, or diagonal) to win.
how_to_play.draw_if_full: If all cells are filled with no winner, it's a draw.

winning_example.description: Here's a clear illustration of how Player 1 ({symbol}) can achieve victory with a diagonal connection on a standard 4x4 board:
winning_example.scenario: In this scenario, Player 1 successfully connects Four {symbol} symbols along a diagonal path, securing the win.

power_ups.title: Power-Ups
power_ups.description: Strategic advantages await! Each player has access to three unique power-ups that can dramatically alter the game's flow. Power-ups have a cooldown period after use, meaning they become available again only after a certain number of turns have passed. Using them at the right moment is key to mastering the game!

freeze.title: Freeze Power-Up
freeze.description: The Freeze power-up allows you to immobilize one of your opponent's active symbols on the board. Once a symbol is frozen, it becomes inactive, meaning:
freeze.list_item_2: It does not contribute to any winning combinations.
freeze.list_item_3: It effectively acts as a block in your opponent's strategy.
freeze.list_item_4: It can still be exchanged using the Swap power-up.
freeze.defensive_tool: This power-up is a defensive tool used to disrupt potential winning lines. It can only target existing opponent symbols, not your own or empty cells. However, if a Bomb power-up hits a frozen cell, it will unfreeze it from the board without remove the symbol.
freeze.example: In this example, Player 1 ({symbol}) has used the Freeze power-up on Player 2's ({symbol2}) symbol in the top-middle cell. This {symbol2} is now frozen, making it unusable in future moves and blocking Player 2 from completing vertical, diagonal, or horizontal lines through that square.

bomb.title: Bomb Power-Up
bomb.description: The Bomb power-up grants you the ability to target any single square on the board. When activated, the selected square and all 8 surrounding adjacent squares (if they exist within the board's boundaries) will be instantly cleared of any symbols. If a targeted square happened to be frozen, the bomb will effectively remove the freeze effect but not the symbol.
bomb.example_before: Player 1 ({symbol}) is about to deploy the Bomb power-up, targeting the marked {symbol2} in the second row, second column. Notice the symbols surrounding it.
bomb.example_after: The {symbol2} and all its adjacent symbols have been successfully cleared, opening up new strategic possibilities for both players.

swap.title: Swap Power-Up
swap.description: The Swap power-up allows you to exchange the positions of any two existing symbols on the board. This power-up is only active when two occupied squares are selected; it cannot be used if you choose an empty square. Utilize this power-up to instantly disrupt your opponent's almost-complete winning lines, or to immediately form your own winning combination!
swap.example_before: Player 2 ({symbol2}) has strategically activated the Swap power-up. They selected their own {symbol2} in the bottom-right corner even though it's frozen and an opponent's {symbol} in the same row. These two symbols are about to swap places, allowing Player 2 to break the opponent's setup and possibly set up a winning line of their own. The Swap power-up can even exchange symbols that are frozen, making it a powerful tool to turn the tide of the game.
swap.example_after: The {symbol} and {symbol2} have successfully swapped places. This strategic move allowed Player 2 ({symbol2}) to immediately complete a vertical winning line through the second column, securing their victory. By leveraging the Swap power-up even with a frozen symbol {symbol2} was able to turn a defensive position into a winning one.
